title: Development of Low-Voltage Ultra-High-Vacuum 4D STEM in FE-SEM System
content: Four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4D STEM) has emerged as a powerful tool in material science, offering detailed insights into the structure and properties of materials. By collecting a series of electron diffraction patterns from a specimen as it is scanned in a raster fashion, 4D STEM bridges the gap between structure and functionality, enabling researchers to explore complex material behaviors and properties [1].
